title: How-To: Assign or Create a Dynamic Field
description:
Show how to create or overwrite fields at query time using assignment and functions such as default().
Dynamic fields are not stored on disk but exist for the lifetime of the query and can be used for
filtering, grouping, and visualization.

examples.name: Create a severity field from status code
examples.description: Creates a derived severity field based on HTTP status, defaulting to info.
